title: Allow using formmethod="dialog" when using enhanced forms

labels.name: forms
labels.description: Stuff relating to forms and form actions

body:
### Describe the problem

I was trying to set up a form inside a dialog, and I had a cancel button with `formmethod="dialog"` and a submit button with a `formaction`. However, when I click the cancel button it still tries to post to the current route, and I got an error because I didn't have any actions set up for the current route (the formaction on the submit button was posting to a different route). I tried removing `method="post"` from the form element, but I got an error saying that `use:enhance` only works on form elements using `method="post"`. Since `formmethod="dialog"` doesn't actually send a request and just closes the modal, I expected this to work.

```svelte
<dialog>
  <form
    method="post"
    use:enhance
  >
    ...other form stuff

    <button type="submit" formmethod="dialog"> Cancel </button>
    <button type="submit" formaction="/another-page?/submitSomething"> Submit </button>
  </form>
</dialog>
```

### Describe the proposed solution

It would be awesome if `use:enhance` could be modified to accommodate `formmethod="dialog"`.
Maybe when `use:enhance` is handling the submission, it could check to see if the button that submitted the form has `formmethod="dialog"` set, and if so it could just bail out since nothing actually needs to be submitted.

### Alternatives considered

The workaround isn't too bad, but it does require JavaScript since the button has to specify an on:click event to call the `dialog.close()` function. `formmethod="dialog"` is just a really slick way of handling modals, especially since it doesn't require JavaScript to work.

```svelte
<script>
  let dialog
</script>

<dialog bind:this={dialog}>
  <form
    method="post"
    use:enhance
  >
    ...other form stuff

    <button type="button" on:click={() => dialog.close()}> Cancel </button>
    <button type="submit" formaction="/another-page?/submitSomething"> Submit </button>
  </form>
</dialog>
```

### Importance

would make my life easier
